sec.p: The prepared essential oil of the flower and leaves were separately tested against the selected strains at concentration of 20 mg/ml adopting the disc agar diffusion method.[ 29] Discs were impregnated with tetracycline and amphotericin B as antibacterial and antifungal standards, respectively. Test solutions were prepared by dissolving in dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO) at a concentration of 20 mg/ml; aliquots, 10 ml each, were aseptically transferred into sterile discs of Whatman filter paper 8 mm diameter. Results are recorded [ Table 3] as a Mean zone of inhibition in mm.
